articles.headline: Harris Has Raised $1 Billion. Can She Get Donors to Give More?
articles.snippet: The sheer amount of money Kamala Harris has raised in her run for president has had unintended consequences.
articles.abstract: The sheer amount of money Kamala Harris has raised in her run for president has had unintended consequences.
articles.lead_paragraph: When 300 top fund-raisers for Vice President Kamala Harris filed into Philadelphia’s Academy of Fine Arts on Sunday evening for a 10-to-a-table dinner, they got to hear from Gov. Josh Shapiro of Pennsylvania and Jaime Harrison, the chairman of the Democratic National Committee.

articles.headline: Trump’s Border Plans Are Light on Details but Strong on Fury
articles.snippet: The former president’s sweeping immigration proposals face daunting challenges, but voters still trust his positions more than his opponent’s.
articles.abstract: The former president’s sweeping immigration proposals face daunting challenges, but voters still trust his positions more than his opponent’s.
articles.lead_paragraph: During a rally in Arizona on Sunday, former President Donald J. Trump left out a crucial detail when promoting his proposal to hire 10,000 new agents to patrol the U.S.-Mexico border.

articles.headline: Lebanon’s Hospitals Buckle Amid Israel’s Offensive Against Hezbollah
articles.snippet: The United Nations says “the targeting of health and relief operations is broadening” in Lebanon. Hospitals say they have been forced to close or are struggling to operate.
articles.abstract: The United Nations says “the targeting of health and relief operations is broadening” in Lebanon. Hospitals say they have been forced to close or are struggling to operate.
articles.lead_paragraph: It was 12:54 a.m., and Elie Hachem had not slept in days when the chief nurse at his Beirut hospital called him in a panic.
articles.byline: By Euan Ward and Diego Ibarra Sanchez

articles.headline: With Trump Facing Threats, Security and Politics Intersect as Never Before
articles.snippet: After two assassination attempts and amid threats from Iran, Donald Trump relies for his safety on the same agencies that he has long assailed as part of a hostile deep state.
articles.abstract: After two assassination attempts and amid threats from Iran, Donald Trump relies for his safety on the same agencies that he has long assailed as part of a hostile deep state.
articles.lead_paragraph: He has been the target of two would-be assassins in a matter of months. The intelligence agencies have told him that Iran is still threatening to kill him, and Iranian hackers got into the email accounts of his aides.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Swan, Maggie Haberman, Julian E. Barnes, Eileen Sullivan, Kate Kelly and Devlin Barrett

articles.headline: With $32 Billion in Aid, Native Americans Push Against History of Neglect
articles.snippet: A pandemic relief bill set aside long-term funds for tribal lands that have lacked the tax revenue, and infrastructure, to spur businesses and wealth.
articles.abstract: A pandemic relief bill set aside long-term funds for tribal lands that have lacked the tax revenue, and infrastructure, to spur businesses and wealth.
articles.lead_paragraph: Cortez, a Colorado town of about 9,000 people tucked near the San Juan Mountains, has the trappings of a humble but healthy small-town economy: bustling businesses, congenial single-family homes, a park with grassy fields, a public pool, playgrounds, a pond and skate ramps.
